API Ref¶

Author: Norland Raphael Hagen <norlandrhagen@gmail.com> Date: 07-23-2021

cmapdata - common - commonly used, generalized functions.

ingest.common.datasetINtblDatasets(dataset_name, server)¶

Return boolean if table exists in tblDatasets

Parameters

  • {string} (server) – Valid CMAP dataset name

  • {string} – Valid CMAP server name. ex Rainer

Returns

Boolean value if table exists

Return type

{bool}

ingest.common.decode_xarray_bytes(xdf)¶

Decode any byte strings in any columns of an xarray dataset

Parameters

{xarray dataset} (xdf) – Input xarray dataset

Returns

Output xarray dataset with decoded byte strings

Return type

{xarray dataset}

ingest.common.double_chars_in_col(df, col, list_of_chars)¶

Replaces a single character with two of the same character. To be used in SQL Server escaping.

Parameters

  • {Pandas DataFrame} (df) – Input Pandas DataFrame

  • {str} (col) – column of DataFrame used in replace

  • {list} (list_of_chars) – A list of strings to be doubled

Returns

Modified Pandas DataFrame

Return type

df (Pandas DataFrame)

ingest.common.empty_list_2_empty_str(inlist)¶

If a input list is empty returns an empty string, if not, list is returned

ingest.common.exclude_val_from_col(series, exclude_list)¶

Exclude any characters in a list from Pandas Series

Parameters

  • {Pandas Series} (series) – Input pandas series

  • {list} (exclude_list) – list of characters to exclude

Returns

Pandas series with characters excluded

Return type

{Pandas Series}

ingest.common.findVarID(datasetID, Short_Name, server)¶

Get ID value from tblVariables for specific variable

ingest.common.getColBounds(df, col, list_multiplier=0)¶

Gets the min and max bounds of a dataframe column

Parameters

  • df (Pandas DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • col (str) – Name of column

  • list_multiplier (int, optional, default = 0) – Output is a a list of returned values with length of length list_multiplier integer

Returns

returns two lists of column mins and maxes

Return type

min_col_list, max_col_list

ingest.common.getCruiseDetails(cruiseName, server)¶

Get cruise details from cruise name using uspCruiseByName

ingest.common.getKeywordsIDDataset(dataset_ID, server)¶

ingest.common.getLatCount(tableName, server)¶

Get count of number of latitude rows from a give table in the database :param tableName {string}: Valid CMAP tablename :param server {string}: Valid CMAP server name. ex Rainer

Returns

count of # of rows in a table

Return type

{int}

ingest.common.get_numeric_cols_in_table_excluding_climatology(tableName, server)¶

Return list of columns in a table that are numeric (float & int) and are not any climatology caluclated fields, eg. dayofyear

Parameters

  • tableName (string) – CMAP table name

  • Server (string) – Valid CMAP server name

Returns

Out Pandas DataFrame

Return type

ingest.common.vault_struct_retrieval(branch)¶

Returns vault structure path for input branch

ingest.common.verify_cruise_lists(dataset_metadata_df, server)¶

Take dataset_metadata_df, match cruise names with those in tblCruise, return tuple of matched and unmatched lists.

Parameters

  • {Pandas DataFrame} (dataset_metadata_df) – dataframe constucted from dataset_meta_data sheet of the CMAP data template.

  • {string} (server) – Valid CMAP server name. ex Rainer

Returns

Two lists, matched and unmatched cruises.

Return type

tuple

Author: Norland Raphael Hagen <norlandrhagen@gmail.com> Date: 07-23-2021

cmapdata - cruise - cruise metadata and trajectory functionallity.

ingest.cruise.ST_bounds_from_df(df)¶

Retrieve ST bounds from input dataframe with time/lat/lon

ingest.cruise.add_ID_trajectory_df(trajectory_df, cruise_name, server)¶

Adds Cruise_ID column to a trajectory dataframe

Parameters

  • trajectory_df (Pandas DataFrame) – Input dataframe containing time/lat/lon cols.

  • cruise_name (str) – Valid CMAP cruise name (UNOLS ex. KM1906)

  • server (str) – [description]

Returns

Trajectory df with Cruise_ID column added

Return type

Pandas DataFrame

ingest.cruise.add_ST_cols_to_metadata_df(metadata_df, trajectory_df)¶

Adds Space-Time columns to metadata df from trajectory df

Parameters

  • metadata_df (Pandas DataFrame) – cruise specific metadata df for tblCruise

  • trajectory_df (Pandas DataFrame) – cruise specific trajectory df for tblCruise_Trajectory

Returns

cruise specific metadata df for tblCruise with ST columns added.

Return type

Pandas DataFrame

ingest.cruise.build_cruise_metadata_from_user_input(df)¶

Attempts to build cruise_metadata dataframe from input trajectory metadata + user input. Recomended to ingest via cruise template instead.

Parameters

df (Pandas DataFrame) – Input dataset dataframe with time/lat/lon.

Returns

Pandas dataframe for tblCruise ingestion. string: cruise_name

Return type

Pandas Dataframe

webscraping

ingest.cruise.parse_r2r_page(url)¶

webscraping

ingest.cruise.resample_trajectory(df, interval='1min')¶

Resamples a cruise trajectory dataframe based on given interval. Default is one minute. Use cases are downsampling super high temporal resolution. ex. GPS.

Parameters

  • df (Pandas DataFrame) – Input dataset dataframe with time/lat/lon.

  • interval (str, optional) – valid pandas resample() interval. Defaults to “1min”.

Returns

Resampled Pandas DataFrame

Return type

Pandas DataFrame

ingest.cruise.return_cruise_trajectory_from_df(df, Cruise_ID)¶

Returns a Pandas DataFrame of time/lat/lon from input dataframe and cruise_ID

ingest.cruise.trim_returned_link(link_str)¶

webscraping helper func for triming strings

ingest.cruise.update_tblCruises(server)¶

old webscraping updating func

ingest.cruise.vault_cruises()¶

Returns cruise dirs from r2r_cruise dir in vault_structure

cmapdata - data - data cleaning and reformatting functions.

ingest.data.ST_columns(df)¶

Returns SpaceTime related columns in a dataset as a list

ingest.data.add_day_week_month_year_clim(df)¶

Takes input pandas DataFrame and adds year, month, week, dayofyear columns to end. IMPORTANT, time column must be in dataframe and be named [time]

Parameters

df (Pandas DataFrame) – Input Pandas DataFrame containing ‘time’ column.

Returns

Output Pandas DataFrame with appended climatology columns

Return type

df Pandas DataFrame

ingest.data.check_ST_ordering(ST_vars)¶

Ensures that ST column list is in correct order. ie [‘time’,’lat’,’lon’] not [‘time’,’lon’,’lat]

Parameters

ST_vars ([type]) – [description]

Returns: ST_vars (sorted)

ingest.data.clean_data_df(df)¶

Combines multiple data functions to apply a clean to a pandas df

ingest.data.data_df_to_db(df, tableName, server, clean_data_df_flag=True)¶

Inserts pandas DataFrame into database using DB.toSQLbcp function.

Parameters

  • df (Pandas DataFrame) – Input Pandas DataFrame

  • tableName (str) – Valid CMAP table name

  • server (str) – Valid CMAP server. ex. Rainier

  • clean_data_df_flag (bool, optional) – Flag to determine if data should be cleaned with the clean_data_df func. Defaults to True.

ingest.data.decode_df_columns(df)¶

Decodes any bytestring columns in pandas

Parameters

df (Pandas DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

Returns

Pandas DataFrame

Return type

df

Parameters

df (Pandas DataFrame) – Input dataframe with ST cols

Returns

Pandas DataFrame with numeric ST cols.

ingest.data.fetch_single_datafile(branch, tableName, process_level='REP', file_ext='.csv')¶

Finds first file in glob with input path to vault structure. Returns path_filename

ingest.data.format_time_col(df, time_col, format='%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')¶

Formats dataframe timecolumn

Parameters

  • df (Pandas DataFrame) – The dataframe to be modified

  • time_col (str) – Name of the time column. ex: ‘time’

  • format (str, optional, default = %Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S) –

Returns

Pandas DataFrame with time col formatted

Return type

df

ingest.data.importDataMemory(branch, tableName, process_level, import_data=True)¶

Imports csv from vault into pandas DataFrame

Parameters

  • branch (str) – vault_structure branch. ex. cruise, float, model

  • tableName (str) – tableName of data import

  • process_level (str) – rep or nrt, determines which leaf level to search

  • import_data (bool, optional) – Bool flag for if data should be imported or only metadata. Defaults to True.

Returns

dictionary containing Pandas Dataframes for data, dataset_meta_data and vars_meta_data

Return type

dictionary

ingest.data.netcdf4_to_pandas(netcdf_file, data_var=None)¶

Imports a netcdf file into a pandas dataframe

ingest.data.netcdf4_to_vaexdf(netcdf_file, data_var=None)¶

Imports a netcdf file into a vaex dataframe using pandas

ingest.data.read_csv(path_and_filename)¶

Imports csv into pandas DataFrame

ingest.data.removeMissings(df, cols)¶

Removes missing rows for all columns provided

Parameters

  • df (Pandas DataFrame) – The dataframe to be modified

  • cols (list) – List of column names

Returns

Pandas DataFrame with missing rows removed

Return type

df

Sorts dataframe cols

Parameters

  • cols (list) – List of column name strings

Returns

Pandas DataFrame with input cols sorts in ASC order.

cmapdata - DB - database connections and CRUD operations.

ingest.DB.DB_modify(cmnd, server)¶

SQL modification function, use with caution!

Parameters

  • cmnd (str) – SQL query. ex. UPDATE tblRegions SET Region = ‘North Pole’ WHERE ID = ‘54NTA’

  • server (str) – Valid CMAP server name. ex Rainier

ingest.DB.DB_query(query)¶

runs a SQL query using the pycmap query functionality

ingest.DB.dbConnect(server)¶

Creates connection with pyodbc

Parameters

server (str) – Valid CMAP server name. ex Rainier

Returns

Returns connection and cursor object for pyodbc connection

Return type

conn, cursor

ingest.DB.dbRead(query, server)¶

runs a SQL query using the pyodbc query functionality

ingest.DB.lineInsert(server, tableName, columnList, query, ID_insert=False)¶

Single line insert functionallity

Parameters

  • server (str) – Valid CMAP server name. ex Rainier

  • tableName (str) – Valid CMAP table name

  • columnList (list) – list of columns in table

  • query (str) – sql query values

  • ID_insert (bool, optional) – Identity_insert. Defaults to False.

ingest.DB.pyodbc_connection_string(server)¶

Returns pyodbc connection string

Parameters

server (str) – Valid CMAP server name. ex Rainier

Returns

connection string

Return type

str

ingest.DB.server_select_credentials(server)¶

Select and returns server credentials based on input server name. Add more servers if needed.

Parameters

server (str) – Valid CMAP server name. ex Rainier

Returns

usr,psw,ip,port,db_name,TDS_Version

Return type

str(s)

ingest.DB.toSQLbcp(export_path, tableName, server)¶

SQL ingestion option, uses bcp (BULK COPY PROGRAM) from MSSQL tools. See: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/tools/bcp-utility?view=sql-server-ver15

ingest.DB.toSQLbcp_wrapper(df, tableName, server)¶

wrapper func for toSQLbcp function. Simplifies arguments

ingest.DB.toSQLbcpandas(df, tableName, server)¶

SQL ingestion option, exploritory, uses bcpandas

ingest.DB.toSQLpandas(df, tableName, server)¶

SQL ingestion option, uses padnas to_sql functionallity.

Parameters

  • df (Pandas DataFrame) – Input Pandas DataFrame

  • tableName (str) – Valid CMAP table name

  • server (str) – Valid CMAP server. ex. Rainier

ingest.DB.urllib_pyodbc_format(conn_str)¶

formats pyodbc connection string with urllib

cmapdata - metadata - cmap metadata formatting for table insertion.

ingest.metadata.classified_gdf_to_list(classified_gdf)¶

Takes a classified/joined geodataframe and returns a set of ocean regions

Parameters

classified_gdf (geopandas geodataframe) – The joined geodataframe that contains points as well as regions.

Returns

A unique list of regions belonging to that dataset.

Return type

region_set

ingest.metadata.classify_gdf_with_gpkg_regions(data_gdf, region_gdf)¶

Takes sparse data geodataframe and classifies it to an ocean region

Parameters

  • data_gdf (geopandas geodataframe) – A geodataframe created from the input CMAP dataframe.

  • region_gdf (geopandas geodataframe) – A geodataframe created from ocean region gpkg.

ingest.metadata.geopandas_load_gpkg(input_df)¶
Parameters

input_df (Pandas DataFrame) – CMAP formatted DataFrame

Returns

Geopandas formatted DataFrame. ie. geometry column.

Return type

gdf (Geopandas GeoDataFrame)

Checks if dataset ID is already in tblDatasets_Regions

Parameters

dataset_name (string) – The short name of the dataset in CMAP tblDatasets.

Returns: Boolean

Uses Geopandas to load input geopackage (gpkg)

Parameters

input_gpkg_fpath (Geopackage - .gpkg) – Input Geopackage containing geometries used for ocean region classifcation.

Returns

Outputs geodataframe of ocean region geometries.

Return type

gpkg_region (GeoDataFrame)

ingest.metadata.ocean_region_classification(data_df, dataset_name, server)¶

This function geographically classifies a sparse dataset into a specific ocean region

Parameters

  • df (Pandas DataFrame) – Input CMAP formatted DataFrame (ST Index: time,lat,lon,<depth>)

  • dataset_name (string) – name of dataset in CMAP

  • cruise_name (string) – UNOLS name

cmapdata - transfer - dataset template moveing and splitting.

ingest.transfer.cruise_file_split(filename, cruise_name)¶

Splits combined cruise template file into cruise metadata and cruise trajectory

Parameters

filename (string) – path name of file.

ingest.transfer.cruise_staging_to_vault(cruise_name, remove_file_flag)¶

Transfer cruise files from staging to vault

Parameters

  • filename – string Filename and extension to be transfered.

  • cruise_name – string UNOLS cruise_name

  • remove_file_flag – bool, default True, optional Flag option for removing input file from staging

ingest.transfer.dropbox_file_transfer(input_file_path, output_file_path)¶

Transfers a file to dropbox using the dropbox v2 python api

Parameters

  • input_file_path (string) – Input filepath, filename and extension to be transfered.

  • output_file_path (string) – Output filepath, filename and extension to be transfered.

ingest.transfer.single_file_split(filename, data_missing_flag)¶

Splits an excel file containing data, dataset_metadata and vars_metadata sheets into three seperate files in the staging file strucutre. If additional metadata filename is provided, data is split.

Parameters

filename (string) – Filename and extension to be split.

ingest.transfer.staging_to_vault(filename, branch, tableName, remove_file_flag=True, skip_data_flag=False, process_level='REP')¶

Transfers a file from staging to vault rep or nrt.

Parameters

  • filename (string) – Filename and extension to be transfered.

  • branch (string) – Vault organization path: ex: vs.cruise

  • tableName (string) – SQL tableName

  • remove_file_flag (bool, default True, optional) – Flag option for removing input file from staging

  • process_level (str, default REP, optional) – Place the data in the REP or the NRT

Author: Norland Raphael Hagen <norlandrhagen@gmail.com> Date: 07-23-2021
